meanings.definition: Capable of being expressed in words
meanings.sent1: The story was so effable that even the youngest children could understand it.
meanings.sent2: The concept was effable enough for the students to grasp easily.
meanings.sent3: The effable explanation made everyone in the room nod in agreement.
meanings.sent4: Her effable instructions were like a clear map guiding us through the task.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's effable examples made the lesson unforgettable.

meanings.sent1: The topic was effable, sparking a lively discussion among the group.
meanings.sent2: It was an effable subject that everyone felt comfortable sharing their thoughts on.
meanings.sent3: The effable news spread quickly throughout the small town.
meanings.sent4: His effable opinions were always welcomed in the debate.
meanings.sent5: The effable nature of the issue made it impossible to ignore.

meanings.definition: Able to be described or communicated
meanings.sent1: The emotions she felt were effable, expressed through her heartfelt words.
meanings.sent2: His feelings were effable, allowing him to articulate them clearly.
meanings.sent3: The effable nature of the painting left the viewers in awe.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the landscape was effable in the artist's masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The melody was so effable that it touched the hearts of all who listened.
